result.execSummary:
The defendant Dontrell D Gibbs was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant will be allow to do 38 hours of Community Service within 90 days in lieu of fine.  Review hearing set fo 9/12/2016 at 1:30 p.m to see if community service has been completed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dontrell D Gibbs

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Received September 14, 2016, from Atty Nicholas Martinez, regarding community service and requesting the Sep 23, 2016 review hearing be removed from the calendar (reviewed by Judge Ramirez, the Sep 23, 2016 review hearing is removed from the calendar)
Received September 13, 2016 from Capuchin Community Services, Dontrell Gibbs has performed 38 hours of community service
Review hearing on September 23, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Review hearing on September 12, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Nick Martinez in court.   Defendant Dontrell D Gibbs did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State amends count #1 to a county ordinance.  Attorney Martinez enters a no contest plea on behalf of his client to count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  Count #2 is dismissed and read in.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Martinez makes statements.  Court orders the following:  FORFEITURE: $389.50.  Court will allow the defendant to do 38 hours of community service within 90 days in lieu of forfeiture.  Court sets a review hearing to make sure community service has been completed.  Review hearing scheduled for September 12, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 8, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Dontrell D Gibbs in court with attorney Nick Martinez.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court questions why the defendant was an hour late.  Attorney Martinez makes statements.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 8, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on May 13, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on May 4, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Defendant to have no contact with co actors, victim/witness/business listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant Dontrell D Gibbs in court.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant was not seen by the Public Defender. Defendant was in custody when the last hearing date was held.  Hearing scheduled for May 4, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Case called at 9:12 am.  Attorney Jess Martinez in court.   Defendant Dontrell D Gibbs did not appear.   Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court revokes/forfeits bail.  Court issues a capias, cashbail in the amount of $500.00.  Defendant still has not appeared at 10:04 am when the warrant authorized.
Hearing at 04-04-2016 08:30 am

Attorney Nick Martinez for Jess Martinez in court.   Defendant Dontrell D Gibbs did not appear.   Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Martinez makes statements regarding the nonappearance of the defendant.  Court excuses the defendant from today's hearing as stated.  Hearing scheduled for April 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Hearing at 02-05-2016 10:30 am
Hearing at 02-01-2016 03:00 pm

Defendant Dontrell D Gibbs not in court.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court received call from the defendant that he could not get a ride.  Court reschedules this matter.  Case recalled at 10:15 am.  Defendant appeared in person.  Defendant wishes to obtain counsel.  Defendant to go directly to the public defenders office after court.  Court schedules this case.
Hearing at 01-04-2016 09:00 am
Defendant to have no contact with co-actors or victim/witness/business listed in the Criminal Complaint.   Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing

Defendant Dontrell D Gibbs in court.  Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.   Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 09:00 am.
